pg:pergamum.name: Help
pg:pergamum.p: This site is designed to provide information on open-source Java books.

Pergamum was a city in southern Turkey which was a competitor to the Great Library in Alexandria. The Egyptians put an export embargo on papyrus to protect themselves from a brain drain and so Pergamum invented the art of writing on animal skins. This is where we get the name parchment.

These are links to external sites:
[amz] is amazon.com
[bkp] is bookpool.com
[jshf] is javashelf.com
Every book has a link, but the book may not be available on said shopping site. They're just blindly linked on what is assumed to be an ISBN.
The look and feel of the site was donated by Tim Vernum, and some tweaks later suggested by Jason Jones.
